splits.name: load_and_store_group_instructions
splits.description: Load and Store Group. LDA (Load Accumulator): Absolute $AD, Zero Page $A5, Immediate $A9, Absolute Indexed X $BD, Absolute Indexed Y $B9, Zero Page Indexed X $B5, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $A1, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $B1; affects N,Z. LDX (Load X Register): Absolute $AE, Zero Page $A6, Immediate $A2, Absolute Indexed Y $BE, Zero Page Indexed Y $B6; affects N,Z. LDY (Load Y Register): Absolute $AC, Zero Page $A4, Immediate $A0, Absolute Indexed X $BC, Zero Page Indexed X $B4; affects N,Z. STA (Store Accumulator): Absolute $8D, Zero Page $85, Absolute Indexed X $9D, Absolute Indexed Y $99, Zero Page Indexed X $95, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $81, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $91; no flags. STX (Store X Register): Absolute $8E, Zero Page $86, Zero Page Indexed Y $96; no flags. STY (Store Y Register): Absolute $8C, Zero Page $84, Zero Page Indexed X $94; no flags.

references.topic: Moving values between accumulator/X/Y registers
Meaning of N and Z flags affected by loads

splits.name: arithmetic_adc_sbc_group
splits.description: Arithmetic Group. ADC (Add with Carry): Absolute $6D, Zero Page $65, Immediate $69, Absolute Indexed X $7D, Absolute Indexed Y $79, Zero Page Indexed X $75, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $61, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $71; affects N,V,Z,C. SBC (Subtract with Carry): Absolute $ED, Zero Page $E5, Immediate $E9, Absolute Indexed X $FD, Absolute Indexed Y $F9, Zero Page Indexed X $F5, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $E1, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $F1; affects N,V,Z,C.

references.topic: Carry, Overflow, Negative, Zero flags used/modified by arithmetic
Branching based on flags after arithmetic results

splits.name: increment_decrement_group
splits.description: Increment and Decrement Group. INC (Increment memory): Absolute $EE, Zero Page $E6, Absolute Indexed X $FE, Zero Page Indexed X $F6; affects N,Z. INX (Increment X): Implied $E8; affects N,Z. INY (Increment Y): Implied $C8; affects N,Z. DEC (Decrement memory): Absolute $CE, Zero Page $C6, Absolute Indexed X $DE, Zero Page Indexed X $D6; affects N,Z. DEX (Decrement X): Implied $CA; affects N,Z. DEY (Decrement Y): Implied $88; affects N,Z.

references.topic: Negative and Zero flags behavior
Using BEQ/BNE/BMI/BPL after INC/DEC/INX/DEX/INY/DEY

splits.name: register_transfer_group
splits.description: Register Transfer Group. TAX (A→X) $AA; TAY (A→Y) $A8; TXA (X→A) $8A; TYA (Y→A) $98; all implied addressing; affect N,Z.

references.topic: Complementary moves between registers and memory
Negative and Zero flags affected by transfers

splits.name: logical_and_eor_ora_group
splits.description: Logical Group. AND (Logical AND): Absolute $2D, Zero Page $25, Immediate $29, Absolute Indexed X $3D, Absolute Indexed Y $39, Zero Page Indexed X $35, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $21, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $31; affects N,Z. EOR (Exclusive OR): Absolute $4D, Zero Page $45, Immediate $49, Absolute Indexed X $5D, Absolute Indexed Y $59, Zero Page Indexed X $55, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $41, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $51; affects N,Z. ORA (Inclusive OR): Absolute $0D, Zero Page $05, Immediate $09, Absolute Indexed X $1D, Absolute Indexed Y $19, Zero Page Indexed X $15, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $01, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $11; affects N,Z.

references.topic: Negative and Zero flags after logical operations
Branching based on flags set by logical ops

splits.name: compare_and_bit_test_group
splits.description: Compare and Bit Test Group. CMP (Compare accumulator): Absolute $CD, Zero Page $C5, Immediate $C9, Absolute Indexed X $DD, Absolute Indexed Y $D9, Zero Page Indexed X $D5, Indexed Indirect ($aa,X) $C1, Indirect Indexed ($aa),Y $D1; affects N,Z,C. CPX (Compare X): Absolute $EC, Zero Page $E4, Immediate $E0; affects N,Z,C. CPY (Compare Y): Absolute $CC, Zero Page $C4, Immediate $C0; affects N,Z,C. BIT (Bit Test): Absolute $2C, Zero Page $24; affects N,V,Z (N and V from memory, Z from A&M).

references.topic: Branching based on comparison/test results (BEQ/BNE/BCS/BCC/BMI/BPL/BVS/BVC)
Interpreting N,Z,C,V flags set by comparisons and BIT

splits.name: shift_and_rotate_group
splits.description: Shift and Rotate Group. ASL (Arithmetic Shift Left): Absolute $0E, Zero Page $06, Accumulator $0A, Absolute Indexed X $1E, Zero Page Indexed X $16; affects N,Z,C. LSR (Logical Shift Right): Absolute $4E, Zero Page $46, Accumulator $4A, Absolute Indexed X $5E, Zero Page Indexed X $56; affects N,Z,C. ROL (Rotate Left): Absolute $2E, Zero Page $26, Accumulator $2A, Absolute Indexed X $3E, Zero Page Indexed X $36; affects N,Z,C. ROR (Rotate Right): Absolute $6E, Zero Page $66, Accumulator $6A, Absolute Indexed X $7E, Zero Page Indexed X $76; affects N,Z,C.

references.topic: Carry, Negative, Zero flags modified by shifts/rotates
Often combined with logical ops for bit manipulation

splits.name: jump_and_branch_group
splits.description: Jump and Branch Group. JMP: Absolute $4C, Indirect $6C; no flags changed. Branches (Relative addressing): BCC $90, BCS $B0, BEQ $F0, BMI $30, BNE $D0, BPL $10, BVC $50, BVS $70; branches depend on C, Z, N, V flags; no flags changed.

references.topic: Typical producers of flag states for branching
Meaning of status flags used by branches
Other control-flow instructions (JSR/RTS/BRK/RTI/NOP)

splits.name: stack_group_operations
splits.description: Stack Group. TSX (Transfer SP→X) $BA; affects N,Z. TXS (Transfer X→SP) $9A; no flags. PHA (Push A) $48; no flags. PHP (Push P) $08; no flags. PLA (Pull A) $68; affects N,Z. PLP (Pull P) $28; updates all status flags.

references.topic: JSR/RTS/BRK/RTI use and manipulate the stack
PLP affects all flags; PLA affects N,Z

splits.name: status_flag_change_group
splits.description: Status Flag Change Group. CLC (Clear Carry) $18; affects C. CLD (Clear Decimal) $D8; affects D. CLI (Clear Interrupt Disable) $58; affects I. CLV (Clear Overflow) $B8; affects V. SEC (Set Carry) $38; affects C. SED (Set Decimal) $F8; affects D. SEI (Set Interrupt Disable) $78; affects I.

references.topic: Arithmetic uses carry/overflow; decimal mode affects ADC/SBC on some 6502s
Branches depend on flag states

splits.name: subroutine_and_interrupt_group
splits.description: Subroutine and Interrupt Group. JSR (Jump to Subroutine) Absolute $20; pushes return address; no flags. RTS (Return from Subroutine) $60; pulls return; no flags. BRK (Force Interrupt) $00; sets B, I. RTI (Return from Interrupt) $40; restores all flags and PC from stack. NOP (No Operation) $EA; no flags.

references.topic: Stack primitives used by JSR/RTS/BRK/RTI
Flags affected/restored by BRK/RTI
Other control-flow mechanisms (JMP/branches)
